title: Highest Energy Consumption per Capita
description: In 2022, Qatar had the highest energy use per capita globally, with 16,683.66 kg of oil equivalent per person.

title: Full Internet Access for Males
description: As of 2020, 100% of the male population in Qatar had access to the internet, marking the highest rate globally.

title: Leading in Gross National Income per Capita
description: Qatar's GNI per capita reached $125,240 in 2023, the highest globally, reflecting its strong economic position.

title: Top Gross Domestic Savings Rate
description: In 2022, Qatar's gross domestic savings accounted for 67.63% of its GDP, the highest percentage worldwide.

title: High Gender Parity in Tertiary Education
description: Qatar achieved a gender parity index of 1.79 in tertiary education enrollment in 2022, indicating a higher female enrollment rate.

title: High Male Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, 96.31% of males aged 15-64 in Qatar participated in the labor force, the highest rate globally.

title: Predominantly Male Population
description: As of 2023, males constituted 71.52% of Qatar's total population, the highest male population percentage worldwide.

title: Significant International Tourism Expenditure
description: In 2020, international tourism expenditures accounted for 19.48% of Qatar's total imports, a leading figure globally.

title: Lowest Household Consumption Expenditure
description: In 2022, Qatar's households and NPISHs final consumption expenditure was only 19.5% of GDP, indicating a low level of household spending relative to the country's economic output.

title: Minimal Forest Depletion
description: Qatar reported an adjusted savings net forest depletion of nearly 0% of GNI in 2021, reflecting minimal impact on its forest resources.

title: Negligible Forest Rents
description: In 2021, forest rents accounted for a mere 0.00007% of Qatar's GDP, highlighting the country's limited reliance on forest resources for economic gain.

title: Low Mortality from Unsafe Water and Sanitation
description: Qatar had a mortality rate of 0.4 per 100,000 population attributed to unsafe water and sanitation in 2019, showcasing effective public health measures.

title: Minimal Employment in Agriculture for Women
description: As of 2023, only 1.5% of female employment in Qatar was in agriculture, indicating a shift towards other sectors.

title: Low Youth Male Unemployment
description: In 2024, Qatar's youth male unemployment rate was just 0.1%, reflecting strong job opportunities for young men.

title: Minimal Unemployment with Basic Education
description: In 2021, only 0.05% of Qatar's labor force with basic education was unemployed, indicating robust employment opportunities for this group.

title: Low Overall Unemployment
description: Qatar's total unemployment rate was 0.13% in 2022, one of the lowest globally, reflecting a strong labor market.

title: Minimal Death Rate
description: In 2023, Qatar had a crude death rate of 0.93 per 1,000 people, indicating a healthy population with low mortality rates.

title: Low Age Dependency Ratio
description: With an age dependency ratio of 20.1% in 2023, Qatar has a relatively low burden on its working-age population.

title: Small Rural Population
description: In 2023, only 0.65% of Qatar's population lived in rural areas, highlighting its urban-centric development.
